chapter.title: JBoss WS and development environment

section.title: JBoss WS Overview
section.para: JBossWS is a web service framework developed as part of the JBoss Application Server. It implements the JAX-WS specification that defines a programming model and run-time architecture for implementing web services in Java, targeted at the Java Platform, Enterprise Edition 5 (Java EE 5)

chapter.title: JBossWS Preferences
chapter.para: In this chapter you get to know how JBossWS preferences can be modified during the development process.
JBossWS preferences can be set using the JBossWS preference page. Click on Window > Preferences > JBoss Tools > Web > JBossWS Preference.
On this page you can manage the JBossWS Runtime. Use the appropriate buttons to Add more runtimes or to Remove those that are not needed.
Clicking on Edit button you will get the form where you can change the path of JBossWS runtime home folder, modify name and version. Press Finish to apply the changes.
